result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. RICK LAMONT CALDWELL

from defendant re: bond (reviewed by court, hearing held)

10:10 AM Defendant Rick Lamont Caldwell in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Rick Lamont Caldwell.  Attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
21CF446, 17CF778, 22CF573
Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing in 21CF446 
Court finds defendant has freely and voluntarily waived his preliminary hearing in 21CF446

Court proceeds with preliminary hearing in case no. 17CF778
Investigator R. Boie is sworn and testifies.
Witness identifies the defendant.
Exhibit 1 is offered and received.
Cross-examination by Attorney Erdman.
Attorney Yohnk makes argument to the Court.
Attorney Erdman makes argument to the Court.
Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

Court proceeds with preliminary hearing in case no. 22CF573
Witness Investigator R. Boie testifies, still under oath.
Attorney Yohnk states parties stipulation to identification of defendant.
Court finds defendant has been identified.
Exhibit 1 is offered and received - exhibit to be confidential, with access to parties.
Cross-examination by Attorney Erdman.
Attorney Erdman makes argument to the Court.
Court finds other felonies are transactionally related, finds probable cause and binds defendant over.
Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:59 AM Defendant RICK LAMONT CALDWELL appeared by video.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for RICK LAMONT CALDWELL. 
22CF573, 21CF446, 17CF778
Court calls case and notes appearances
Time set for motion filed by Attorney Erdman
Attorney Erdman makes statement re: request for bond modification
State opposes modification of bond
Attorney Erdman responds
Court denies bond modification
Bond continues
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
